intro: Lathyrus karsianus, commonly known as the Karsian vetch, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. It is a perennial legume that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, featuring slender, branching stems. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers in shades of violet or blue, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three oval-shaped leaflets, and it has a fibrous root system. Lathyrus karsianus is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in alpine meadows and forest edges.
